resource_data:
<expression xsi:schemaLocation="http://www.imsglobal.org/xsd/imslorsltitm_v1p0 http://fire.eun.org/lode/imslorsltitm_v1p0.xsd" xmlns="http://www.imsglobal.org/xsd/imslorsltitm_v1p0" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance">
  <identifier>
    <catalog>hdl</catalog>
    <entry>10494/108266</entry>
  </identifier>
  <identifier>
    <catalog>expression-cmr-id</catalog>
    <entry>108266</entry>
  </identifier>
  <description>
    <facet>
      <vocabularyID>LRE.expressionDescriptionFacetValues</vocabularyID>
      <value>main</value>
    </facet>
    <metadata>
      <schema>http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM</schema>
      <lom xsi:schemaLocation="http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/lomv1.0/lomLoose.xsd" xmlns="http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM">
        <general>
          <identifier>
            <catalog>oercommons.org</catalog>
            <entry>1765086825</entry>
          </identifier>
          <title>
            <string language="en">Shoemakers in a "ten-footer" shop.</string>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Schuster in einem "ten-Seitenende" System.</string>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">Cordonniers dans un système de "dix-titre de bas 
de page".</string>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Shoemakers em uma loja do "dez-ten-footer".</string>
            <string language="x-mt-it">Calzolai in un negozio "del dieci-ten-footer".</string>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Οι υποδηματοποιοί σε μια "δέκα-υποσημείωση" ψωνίζουν.</string>
            <string language="x-mt-es">Zapateros en un departamento del "diez-pie".</string>
          </title>
          <description>
            <string language="en">Like many other industries, shoe manufacturing changed in the early 19th century. Previously, most shoemakers worked in their homes or small workshops (called ten-footers")</string>
          </description>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">Humanities</string>
          </keyword>
          <language>en</language>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Wie viele andere Industrien änderte Schuhherstellung im 
frühen 19. Jahrhundert. Vorher arbeiteten die meisten Schuster 
in ihren Häusern oder in kleinen Werkstätten (genannt 
ten-Seitenende")</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">Comme beaucoup d'autres industries, la fabrication de 
chaussure a changé au 19ème siècle tôt. Précédemment, la 
plupart des cordonniers travaillés dans leurs maisons ou petits 
ateliers (appelés les dix-titres de bas de page")</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Como muitas outras indústrias, o manufacturing da sapata 
mudou no 1ø século adiantado. Previamente, a maioria de 
shoemakers trabalharam em suas HOME ou oficinas pequenas (chamadas 
dez-ten-footers")</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-it">Come molte altre industrie, il manufacturing del pattino 
è cambiato nel diciannovesimo secolo in anticipo. 
Precedentemente, la maggior parte dei calzolai funzionati nelle 
loro sedi o fabbriche di limitata entità (chiamate 
dieci-ten-footers")</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Όπως πολλές άλλες βιομηχανίες, η κατασκευή 
παπουτσιών άλλαξε στις αρχές του 19$ου αιώνα. Προηγουμένως,
οι περισσότεροι υποδηματοποιοί εργάστηκαν στα σπίτια ή τα μικρά 
εργαστήριά τους (αποκαλούμενα δέκα-υποσημειώσεισ")</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-es">Como muchas otras industrias, la fabricación del zapato 
cambió en el diecinueveavo siglo temprano. Previamente, la 
mayoría de los zapateros trabajados en sus hogares o talleres 
pequeños (llamados diez-pies")</string>
          </description>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Menschlichkeit</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">Sciences humaines</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Humanities</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-it">Studi umanistici</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Ανθρωπότητες</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-es">Humanidad</string>
          </keyword>
        </general>
        <lifeCycle>
          <contribute>
            <role>
              <source>roleValues</source>
              <value>author</value>
            </role>
            <entity>BEGIN:VCARD
N:CENTER FOR HISTORY AND NEW MEDIA/AMERICAN SOCIAL HISTORY PROJECT
FN:CENTER FOR HISTORY AND NEW MEDIA/AMERICAN SOCIAL HISTORY PROJECT
VERSION:3.0
END:VCARD</entity>
          </contribute>
        </lifeCycle>
        <metaMetadata>
          <identifier>
            <catalog>oercommons.org</catalog>
            <entry>1765086825</entry>
          </identifier>
          <language>en</language>
        </metaMetadata>
        <educational>
          <language>en</language>
        </educational>
        <rights>
          <copyrightAndOtherRestrictions>
            <source>copyrightAndOtherRestrictionsValues</source>
            <value>no</value>
          </copyrightAndOtherRestrictions>
          <description>
            <string language="en">No License</string>
          </description>
        </rights>
      </lom>
    </metadata>
  </description>
  <manifestation>
    <identifier>
      <catalog>manifestation-cmr-id</catalog>
      <entry>108266</entry>
    </identifier>

      <vocabularyID>LRE.manifestationNameValues</vocabularyID>
      <value>experience</value>
    </name>
    <item>
      <location>
        <uri>http://www.oercommons.org/libraries/shoemakers-in-a-ten-footer-shop</uri>
      </location>
    </item>
  </manifestation>
</expression>
